results.title: MANAGEMENT OF RISKS OF ADVERSE DRUG REACTIONS ACCORDING TO ADR REPORT FORM DATA FROM LVIV REGION HEALTHCARE FACILITIES IN 2022.
results.text_hl: In the category of CCB drugs, @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (66%) and @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@ (20%) held the leading positions. among angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ caused the most prevalent and predicted adverse reaction, that of @<m>DISEASE_Cough</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@, affecting 10.5% of patients, whereas, with the combination therapy of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@, the @<m>DISEASE_Cough</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ was observed in only 5.2% of patients.

citations.NLM: Stepaniuk N, Piniazhko O, Poshyvak O, Bessarab T, Hudz N, Gavriluk I. MANAGEMENT OF RISKS OF ADVERSE DRUG REACTIONS ACCORDING TO ADR REPORT FORM DATA FROM LVIV REGION HEALTHCARE FACILITIES IN 2022. Georgian Med News. 2023 Jul-Aug;(340-341):76-80. PMID: 37805878

results.title: Female sex as an important determinant of lisinopril-induced cough.
results.text_hl: Female sex as an important determinant of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Cough</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@.

results.title: ACE inhibitors and cough.
results.text_hl: In conclusion, although @<m>DISEASE_Cough</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ may occur with all four types of ACE inhibitors, the incidence of this side effect was higher during @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@ treatment than during @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Perindopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020913 @@@perindopril@@@ treatment.

citations.NLM: Yeşil S, Yeşil M, Bayata S, Postaci N. ACE inhibitors and cough. Angiology. 1994 Sep;45(9):805-8. PMID: 8092546
citations.BibTeX: @article{8092546, title={ACE inhibitors and cough.}, author={Yeşil S and Yeşil M and Bayata S and Postaci N}, journal={Angiology}, volume={45}, number={9}, pages={805-8}}

results.title: ACE inhibitors, angiotensin II antagonists and cough. The Losartan Cough Study Group.
results.text_hl: The specific selective AT1 angiotensin II receptor antagonist @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ is significantly less likely than @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ to cause @<m>DISEASE_Cough</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who previously have had ACE inhibitor @<m>DISEASE_Cough</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@.

citations.NLM: Ramsay LE, Yeo WW. ACE inhibitors, angiotensin II antagonists and cough. The Losartan Cough Study Group. J Hum Hypertens. 1995 Nov;9 Suppl 5():S51-4. PMID: 8583482
citations.BibTeX: @article{8583482, title={ACE inhibitors, angiotensin II antagonists and cough. The Losartan Cough Study Group.}, author={Ramsay LE and Yeo WW}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={9 Suppl 5}, pages={S51-4}}

results.title: [Cough induced by angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors: report of a case by lysinopril].
results.text_hl: [@<m>DISEASE_Cough</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@Cough@@@ induced by angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors: report of a case by @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lysinopril@@@].

results.title: An open trial of lisinopril ('ZESTRIL') in mild to moderate hypertension in Nigeria.
results.text_hl: Of the 46 evaluable @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, 32 (70%) had their blood pressure controlled (i.e. diastolic blood pressure < or = 90 Hg). @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ ('@<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Zestril@@@') was well tolerated, with 27% of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ reporting adverse reactions of which @<m>DISEASE_Cough</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ was the most common.

citations.NLM: Abengowe CU, Ezedinachi EN, Balogun MO. An open trial of lisinopril ('ZESTRIL') in mild to moderate hypertension in Nigeria. West Afr J Med. 1997 Oct-Dec;16(4):218-22. PMID: 9473956
citations.BibTeX: @article{9473956, title={An open trial of lisinopril ('ZESTRIL') in mild to moderate hypertension in Nigeria.}, author={Abengowe CU and Ezedinachi EN and Balogun MO}, journal={West Afr J Med}, volume={16}, number={4}, pages={218-22}}
